data.description: From Rumpelstiltskin to Rapunzel, the rich fairy-tale tradition of the German-speaking world is filled with familiar themes and subversive morals. With an eye to depictions of gender, gender roles, sexuality, and race, we critically engage with these tales and contextualize them within the social and political landscapes that shaped them.
data.title: FROM GRIMM TO GRYFFINDOR: GERMAN FAIRYTALES (RE)IMAGINED
